subject: Design
title: Age-Inclusive Design: From 8 to 80
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Age-Inclusive Design: From 8 to 80.

hook.text: By 2050, 2 billion people will be over 60. Most apps are designed by 25-year-olds for 25-year-olds.

buildup.text: Aging reduces vision, dexterity, and memory. Small text, tiny tap targets, and complex navigation become barriers.

discovery.text: Google's 48dp minimum touch target and Apple's Dynamic Type were designed with aging populations in mind.

twist.text: The fastest-growing smartphone user group is over 65. They're the market, not an edge case.

climax.text: Age-inclusive design anticipates everyone's future. You will be old. Will the interface still work for you?

punchline.text: Designing for elderly users is just designing for your future self.

quiz.question: Why is age-inclusive design increasingly important?
